EmailTemplate.name: Geode Clubhouse 11-3-15.Geode Clubhouse 11-3-15 Webinar
EmailTemplate.subject: Geode Clubhouse: OQL Querying and Indexing in Apache Geode (incubating)
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
OQL Querying and Indexing in Apache Geode (incubating) Spring Developers use the Spring Data GemFire API to develop highly scaled low-latency applications using Pivotal GemFire or Apache Geode (incubating).
Learn more about Apache Geode at the next Apache Geode Clubhouse meeting. We will discuss how to use Object Query Language (OQL) to create queries in Apache Geode. We will cover query syntax, how the query engine executes a query on a partitioned region, what index types are supported in Geode, and some miscellaneous querying related topics (Undefined objects, Geode specific keywords)
Featured Presenter: Jason Huynh, Apache Geode Committer
No registration is required. Simply join the session here <https://pivotalcommunity.adobeconnect.com/clubhouse/>.
For a reminder, please subscribe to the Apache Geode User Maillist <user-subscribe@geode.incubator.apache.org>. North America Tuesday, November 3, 2015 9:00AM PDT (San Francisco, GMT-07:00) Connecting <https://pivotalcommunity.adobeconnect.com/clubhouse/>
